citation.article-title: Streptococcus dentapri sp. nov., isolated from the wild boar oral cavity
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptococcus dentapri sp. nov.
Streptococcus dentapri (den.tap′ri. L. n. dens, -tis tooth; L. masc. n. aper, apri wild boar; N.L. gen. n. dentapri from the tooth of a wild boar).
Cells are Gram-stain-positive, non-spore-forming cocci occurring in pairs or short chains.
Colonies on blood agar are small and white, 0.75–1.0 mm in diameter and non-haemolytic at 37 °C for 24 h.
The cells form small, dark-blue, crinkled colonies on MS agar.
No Lancefield carbohydrate antigens are detected.

With Rapid ID32 Strep and API 50CH, produces acid from glucose, fructose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, sucrose and trehalose, but not from galactose, lactose, d-ribose, raffinose, melibiose or tagatose.

With Rapid ID32 Strep and API ZYM, alanine-phenylalanine-proline arylamidase, α- and β-glucosidases, acid and alkaline phosphatases, leucine, valine and cystine arylamidases and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase are produced.
Arginine dihydrolase, β-glucuronidase, α- and β-galactosidases and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase are not produced.
A water-insoluble glucan is produced by glucosyltransferase from sucrose.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 39.9 mol%.
The type strain is NUM 1529T (=JCM 15752T =DSM 21999T), isolated from the oral cavity of a wild boar.
